TopicTitle: Make a wish... and have it horribly corrupted!

Articles.Content:
Granted. It has no extra lag in the game, but it does lag your computer to the point of crashing.

I wish Valve would learn to count to 3 already.

Granted. Portal 3's an okay-ish game, but not a patch on the previous titles.

I wish it wasn't so late.

Granted, you must move to California.

I wish I had a wish.

Granted. It's corrupted.

I wish I could think of a wish.

Granted, but it is used up in itself.

I wish for Zokesia to conquer Kerbin.

Granted. But the resistance keeps killing its soldiers, and ultimately assassinates Zokesia's leader.

I wish I had a wider desk. Actually I have one to my left, I wish it was clear though not covered in junk.

Granted, but when you clear it, it turns out it was covering an embarrassing photo of you when someone walks in

I wish I can eat KFC

Granted. You are transported to Kentucky at the time the Fried Chicken was introduced to Kentucky. (very long ago)

I wish for a tube-shaped fuel tank, rather than a cylindrical one.

Granted. It contains so much fuel that the amount of any stock engine in the game that could lift it crashes the game.

I wish I ate waffles.

Granted. The waffles are Luftwaffes and they bomb you.

I wish for a fish that had a dish of "mish".

As i don't understand, you get granted with something you don't understand too.

I wish for more publicity everywhere. . . . . . . . . . .

Your publicity goes overload, and everyone stalks you for the rest of your life.

I wish that other species could be added into KSP

granted, but it is done by a hacker an is removed within 3 seconds because ksp WILL NOT HAVE ALIENS CONFIREMD.

I wish that all the caption threads will go away

Granted. The game is reduced to Yet Another Multiplayer FPS, depicting a three-way battle between humans, Kerbals, and generic buglike aliens. While the rockets and orbital mechanics are retained, hardly anyone ever uses them - they take ages to fly and are way too vulnerable to the missile launcher, and the bugs' antigravity ships outclass the rockets anyway when below their 100 km ceiling. Simply joining a game playing Kerbal will invariably get you insulted as a know-nothing n00b, and if you actually do pull off a launch to orbit you're a dirty camping lamer who should come down and fight properly.

Edit: Oh gosh darn it

I wish I had an indefinitely enlargeable monitor with full control over its size.

granted. you break it and it explodes.

I wish that all the caption threads will go away and it will not be because someone nuked the forum games server from orbit

Granted. Someone conventionally bombed the forum games server from orbit

I wish I had a machine that generates an anti-explosion field.

Granted, but it's incredibly prone to exploding.

I wish I had a broomstick.

Granted, but it was stolen. The witch who owns it finds you and turns you into a hippopotamus.

I wish for a carrot.

Granted, but the carrot gives you food poisoning you can never recover from.

I wish for my KSP not to crash like crazy.

granted. it crashes like insane because Danny got into your house.

I wish to be good at FTL (as in get to sector 5 at least)

Granted, but you go FTL and the game crashes

I wish for a Kerbal FPS

Granted. All of the bullets are affected by drag so much that they stop before they go one foot.

I wish that pieces of cardboard could be used as RAM.

Granted. Pieces of cardboard are, however, incompatible with any existing computer systems and can only be used as RAM for extremely expensive prototype computers that don't even exist yet.

I wish I had a paintbrush.

Granted, but the paintbrush has only one hair like spongebobs

I wish there was a funny parts mod for KSP

Granted. However, these parts take up so much memory that your game crashes immediately when trying to load it.

I wish for my procrastination to end.
